awd_abstract_narration:
The purpose of this project is to organize and host the 2023 National Science Foundation (NSF) CIRC Community Principal Investigators Meeting. The meeting will take place in fall 2023 on the campus of the University of Utah in Salt Lake City, Utah. The meeting will convene the principal investigators (PIs) of active awards within the Community Infrastructure for Research in CISE (CIRC) program, formerly known as the CISE Community Research Infrastructure (CCRI) program. It will be a venue where PIs, local government and community organization representatives, and Federal agency representatives meet to present and review CIRC progress and developments, identify new and emerging areas for research infrastructure, and discuss research infrastructure gaps and barriers. The meeting agenda includes plenary presentations of showcase CIRC projects, poster presentations by all PIs, reports of recent program activities, a keynote address, a panel discussion, and breakout discussions on topics to be determined by the community.

The annual PI Meeting is the primary opportunity for NSF-funded CIRC/CCRI PIs to meet as a group to share their progress, discuss research infrastructure opportunities and challenges, and explore new ideas and partnerships for future work. It is a forum for sharing ideas across the CIRC community. It is also an opportunity for the academic community to interact with government agencies with interest in CIRC developments and advancements. The CIRC/CCRI PI Meeting series has played a major role in growing the community across a broad range of sectors and technologies, and in performing outreach to parties who have interest in learning about the program and participating as future proposers, transition partners, or sponsors.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

por.por_cntn:
This project supported the planning, organization, and hosting of the 2023 CIRC Community Principal Investigators Meeting. The meeting was a venue where principal investigators (PIs), NSF Program Directors, and other stakeholders assembled to present and exchange information about projects supported by the NSF's Community Infrastructure for Research in CISE (CIRC) program, formerly known as the CISE Community Research Infrastructure (CCRI) program. Regular CIRC community PI meetings are crucial for sharing knowledge about the design, implementation, operation, and sustainability of research infrastructure; facilitating discussions among PIs and NSF Program Directors about existing infrastructure and future directions; and advancing the purposes and goals of the CIRC program overall.

The 2023 CIRC Community PI Meeting was held November 6-7, 2023, on the campus of the University of Utah in Salt Lake City, Utah. More than 100 people registered for and attended the 1.5-day event. The program included welcome remarks from the NSF CISE/CNS Division Director; two keynote addresses; nineteen short presentations by the PIs and co-PIs of selected CIRC projects; an expert panel about mid-scale infrastructure projects; a short talk about community engagement; three concurrent breakout sessions; an evening poster session and reception; and office hours with NSF Program Directors. The PI of this project organized all aspects of the meeting in consultation with the NSF CIRC Program Directors. The results of a post-meeting participant survey indicated that the meeting attendees were very satisfied with the PI meeting.

Beyond holding the 2023 CIRC Community Principal Investigators Meeting, this project supported the dissemination of the meeting's products. These products included the participants' presentation slides, the participants' posters, and the breakout session reports. The PI of this project collected electronic versions of these products and incorporated them into the website that he created for the meeting. The meeting website, found at https://nsf-circ23.utah.edu/, serves as a public record of the meeting and its outcomes, disseminating the results of the meeting to the CIRC community and to the public.

The intellectual merit of this project was realized through its facilitation of information exchange among participants in the NSF CIRC program. The CIRC Community Principal Investigators Meeting advanced the purpose of the CIRC program, to support the creation and enhancement of world-class research infrastructure.

The broader impacts of this project arose through opportunities for participants in the CIRC Community Principal Investigators Meeting to expand their professional networks. The interactions that took place during the PI meeting may lead to subsequent collaborations or other future opportunities among the meeting participants, both related and unrelated to the advancement of research infrastructure.


Last Modified: 12/13/2024
Modified by: Eric N Eide
